alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Greene; Inland Onslow; Jones; Lenoir; Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jones, Greene, Lenoir, western Pitt, western Onslow and Duplin Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Snow Hill to near Wallace. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Jacksonville, Kinston, Winterville, Ayden, Farmville, Wallace, Warsaw, La Grange, Half Moon, Mount Olive, Grifton, Phillips Crossroads, Kornegay, Rose Hill, Snow Hill, Richlands, Bell Arthur, Beulaville and Deep Run. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for eastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Duplin; Greene; Inland Onslow; Jones; Lenoir; Pitt
